titleStmt.title: The distressed mother: or, sorrowful wife in tears: being a full and true account of a most horrid, barbarous and bloody murther, committed at Chatham, in the county of Kent, on Tuesday the 16th of this instant September, by one Mrs. Katherine Fox, a Gentlewoman, on the body of her own husband, and two children, by cutting their throats form ear to ear; with the manner of her apprehending and taking, examination and confession before the worshipful Justice Bourchier, and commitment to Maidstone goal for the same.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Beuvet near Billingsgate,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
